meanings.definition: Having the aroma or flavor of thyme.
meanings.sent1: The soup was thymey, making it taste like a garden.
meanings.sent2: The roasted chicken was deliciously thymey with herbs.
meanings.sent3: The thymey bread smelled so good that it attracted all the bees.
meanings.sent4: The air in the kitchen was thymey, like a fragrant cloud.
meanings.sent5: The thymey scent lingered in the room, reminding me of a summer garden.

meanings.sent1: The thymey plant in the garden looked just like thyme.
meanings.sent2: The sauce had a thymey taste that reminded me of the herb.
meanings.sent3: The thymey carpet made the room feel like a herb garden.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a thymey color, like the leaves of the herb.
meanings.sent5: The thymey appearance of the dish made it seem like a thyme-infused creation.

meanings.sent1: The thymey chicken was seasoned with fresh herbs.
meanings.sent2: The thymey salad was a delightful mix of greens and thyme leaves.
meanings.sent3: The thymey blanket smelled like a herb garden, making it cozy.
meanings.sent4: The thymey fields stretched out like a green carpet of herbs.
meanings.sent5: The thymey landscape was a picturesque scene of thyme-covered hills.
